connector.description: Read and write from/to Infinispan distributed key/value store and data grid.

camel.sink.path.cacheName.name: camel.sink.path.cacheName
camel.sink.path.cacheName.description: The name of the cache to use. Use current to use the existing cache name from the currently configured cached manager. Or use default for the default cache manager name.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultValue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultValue
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultValue.description: Set a specific default value for some producer operations

camel.sink.endpoint.key.name: camel.sink.endpoint.key
camel.sink.endpoint.key.description: Set a specific key for producer operations

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.oldValue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.oldValue
camel.sink.endpoint.oldValue.description: Set a specific old value for some producer operations

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to perform One of: [PUT] [PUTASYNC] [PUTALL] [PUTALLASYNC] [PUTIFABSENT] [PUTIFABSENTASYNC] [GET] [GETORDEFAULT] [CONTAINSKEY] [CONTAINSVALUE] [REMOVE] [REMOVEASYNC] [REPLACE] [REPLACEASYNC] [SIZE] [CLEAR] [CLEARASYNC] [QUERY] [STATS] [COMPUTE] [COMPUTEASYNC]

camel.sink.endpoint.value.name: camel.sink.endpoint.value
camel.sink.endpoint.value.description: Set a specific value for producer operations

camel.sink.endpoint.cacheContainer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cacheContainer
camel.sink.endpoint.cacheContainer.description: Specifies the cache Container to connect

camel.sink.endpoint.cacheContainerConfig.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cacheContainerConfiguration
camel.sink.endpoint.cacheContainerConfig.description: The CacheContainer configuration. Used if the cacheContainer is not defined.

camel.sink.endpoint.configurationUri.name: camel.sink.endpoint.configurationUri
camel.sink.endpoint.configurationUri.description: An implementation specific URI for the CacheManager

camel.sink.endpoint.flags.name: camel.sink.endpoint.flags
camel.sink.endpoint.flags.description: A comma separated list of org.infinispan.context.Flag to be applied by default on each cache invocation

camel.sink.endpoint.remappingFunction.name: camel.sink.endpoint.remappingFunction
camel.sink.endpoint.remappingFunction.description: Set a specific remappingFunction to use in a compute operation.

camel.sink.endpoint.resultHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.resultHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.resultHeader.description: Store the operation result in a header instead of the message body. By default, resultHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body, any existing content in the message body is discarded. If resultHeader is set, the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved. This value can be overridden by an in message header named: CamelInfinispanOperationResultHeader

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.defa.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.defaultValue
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.defa.description: Set a specific default value for some producer operations

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.key.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.key
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.key.description: Set a specific key for producer operations

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.lazy.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.lazy.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.oldV.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.oldValue
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.oldV.description: Set a specific old value for some producer operations

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.oper.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.operation
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.oper.description: The operation to perform One of: [PUT] [PUTASYNC] [PUTALL] [PUTALLASYNC] [PUTIFABSENT] [PUTIFABSENTASYNC] [GET] [GETORDEFAULT] [CONTAINSKEY] [CONTAINSVALUE] [REMOVE] [REMOVEASYNC] [REPLACE] [REPLACEASYNC] [SIZE] [CLEAR] [CLEARASYNC] [QUERY] [STATS] [COMPUTE] [COMPUTEASYNC]

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.valu.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.value
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.valu.description: Set a specific value for producer operations

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.auto.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.auto.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.cach.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.cacheContainer
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.cach.description: Specifies the cache Container to connect

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.cach.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.cacheContainerConfiguration
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.cach.description: The CacheContainer configuration. Used if the cacheContainer is not defined.

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.conf.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.configurationUri
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.conf.description: An implementation specific URI for the CacheManager

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.flag.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.flags
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.flag.description: A comma separated list of org.infinispan.context.Flag to be applied by default on each cache invocation

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.rema.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.remappingFunction
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.rema.description: Set a specific remappingFunction to use in a compute operation.

camel.component.infinispan-embedded.resu.name: camel.component.infinispan-embedded.resultHeader
camel.component.infinispan-embedded.resu.description: Store the operation result in a header instead of the message body. By default, resultHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body, any existing content in the message body is discarded. If resultHeader is set, the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved. This value can be overridden by an in message header named: CamelInfinispanOperationResultHeader
